title: Low FPS with Ubuntu 16.04
body:
I followed just about every guide I could possibly find online (even the "144fps reddit guide") but not very many cover the 16.04 version.

I'm pretty sure I have everything I need installed like Wine, PoL, proper Nvidia graphics driver (and it's loaded), and  I know my computer can handle the game. I was able to run everything maxed out with 100+fps on my BROKEN windows 8 OS.

If anyone could help that would be awesome, I have gone to long with out my favorite game.... (cough 3 days cough)

Specs (still work in progress, that's why it might seem weird):

i5-3470 CPU @ 3.20GHz x4
8gigs Ram
GeForce GTX Titan
Ubuntu 16.04 64bit
1T SSD

replies.body:
As big of a fan of Linux as I am, it pains me to tell you that we cannot provide troubleshooting steps or support for Linux since League only [officially supports macOS and Windows.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/) 

I recommend reaching out to the community on the [Wine Forums](https://forum.winehq.org/) for assistance with this. Good luck and let me know if you have any questions.

Then why don't you guys just make a linux client? Mac is Unix/Linux and you make it for that but not us third party users? Why that is so disappointing. I am glad I am a CS major and have been programming since I was 12 (proud to say I learned ASM first)... Give me all I need to make the client myself, Tired of you guys honestly. Runescape (Jagex) even made a client for linux users and you guys are more popular, so why haven't and why won't you? I just think you guys are not so bright sometimes.
